summary: Five online courses pursuant of certification in brewing beer that target each main ingredient in recipe production and beer packaging.
notes: Online coursework covering each main ingredient of beer and how it's packaged and served
Includes focus on recipe creation, ingredient selection, process improvement, and targeting particular styles.

courses.name: Malt Evaluation
courses.description: An in-depth look at the malting and mashing processes, and the targeted use of specialty/alternative grains when constructing a grain bill

courses.name: Water Profiles
courses.description: Examining the chemical properties of supply and production water and how it can be adjusted towards particular styles

courses.name: Hops Flavor Chemistry
courses.description: A detailed investigation into the use of aroma and bittering hops to achieve desired flavor, aroma, and bitterness using myriad varieties.

courses.name: Yeast and Fermentation
courses.description: A deep dive into the role of yeast in alcohol production and flavor with particular focus on troubleshooting and pitching.

courses.name: Beer Production and Refinement
courses.description: A summative synthesis of how each ingredient interacts and can be finessed and adjusted into a consistent and perfected product.

summary: Intensive 11-week program for newly-hired firefighters, resulting in nationally-recognized certifications
notes: Collection of various training courses from the NYS Academy of Fire Science taken concurrently over 11 weeks
Used by paid departments across the state of a NY as a way to prepare new recruits for the fire service.

courses.name: Firefighter Essentials
courses.description: Introduction to fire behavor and suppression.

courses.name: Vehicle Rescue - Operations Level
courses.description: Responding to Motor Vehicle Accidents and car fires, including stabilization and extrication.

courses.name: Technical Rescue Basic
courses.description: Introduction to technical rescue, including rope systems and rapelling.

courses.name: Emergency Vehicle Operations Course
courses.description: The safe and effective operation of Fire Apparatus in transport and at the emergency scene.

courses.name: SCBA Confidence
courses.description: Firefighter rescue and rapid intervention, confined space awareness, and self-extrication.

courses.name: Engine Operations
courses.description: Introduction to pump operations and water supply.

courses.name: Truck Operations
courses.description: Orientation to truck operations including ladders, search, and ventilation.

courses.name: Hazardous Materials
courses.description: Identification and management of incidents involving Hazardous Materials and acts of terror.

courses.name: Flamable Gases
courses.description: Practical and theoretical basis of working with and handling flamable gas emergencies, storage, and transport as well as utilities.

courses.name: Firefighter II
courses.description: Advanced topics in pre-planning, incident management, tactics, and response.

notes: Application Domain in 'Library and Information Science', Minor in Philosophy
Worked on over a dozen 2-6 person teams, in as many languages/technologies, and completed 20+ SE courses, towards the completion of a competitive degree, punctuated by meaningful work experience.

courses.name: Professional Communications
courses.description: Learned the pyramid method of effective and succinct communication.

courses.name: Intro to Computer Science I+II
courses.description: Covered programming fundamentals and data structures.

courses.name: Intro to Computer Science Theory
courses.description: Theoretical foundations of automata, NP completeness, and complexity.

courses.name: Principles of Data Management
courses.description: Systematic review of relational database design, construction, and maintenence using SQL.

courses.name: Introduction to Data Mining
courses.description: Learned, implemented, and applied data mining algorithms, techniques, and theory.

courses.name: Introduction to Archives
courses.description: Read, discussed, and wrote about mission, practice, and problems of maintaining digital and analog archive collections.

courses.name: Cultural Informatics
courses.description: Explored the roles, relationships, and potential of technology, metadata, collection management, and digital humanities.

courses.name: Ancient Philosophy
courses.description: Studies in early Greek philosophy, covering Plato, Aristotle, and various pre-platonists and Hellenists.

courses.name: Modern Philosophy
courses.description: Readings and discussions on Descartes, Spinoza, Berkeley, Hume, and Kant.

courses.name: Theories of Knowledge
courses.description: Readings and discussions on the nature and acquisition of knowledge and truth in the context of epistemological skepticism.

courses.name: Ethical Theory
courses.description: Exploration into the source, reach, and requirements of ethics with particular attention to Singer and Mill.

courses.name: Mathematical Models of Software Engineering
courses.description: Using modeling software to effectively predict, analyze, and manage software state, and to solve logical puzzles from lists of truths.

courses.name: Personal Software Engineering
courses.description: A primer on the pure construction of systems of software in a variety of languages by a single developer.

courses.name: Software Process and Project Management
courses.description: A deep dive into the history, practice, trends, and methodologies of organizing and executing software projects (focusing on SCRUM/Agile).

courses.name: Intro to Software Engineering
courses.description: A vital course offering a holistic picture of the joint construction of quality software, including all its phases and non-code deliverabluse.

courses.name: Engineering Software Subsystems
courses.description: An invaluable course studying the theory, practice, and vital importance of software architecture and design, heavy on patterns and philosophies.

courses.name: Engineering Secure Software
courses.description: A primer on identifying valuable assets, understanding and investing in security as quality to protect against common vulnerabilities, and learning from famous exploits.

courses.name: Intro to Web Engineering
courses.description: A project and workshop-based course explaining and demonstrating the various technologies at the core of modern web development (REST microservices, javascript frameworks, HTML5).

courses.name: Software Testing
courses.description: Training using a variety of testing strategies, modes, methods, and tools.

courses.name: Human Centered Requirements and Design
courses.description: Project-based class on eliciting, negotiating, managing, translating, and fulfilling requirements.

courses.name: Senior Project
courses.description: Design and construct a cross-platform phone application to expedite job search and application.

courses.name: Data Processing in Software Engineering
courses.description: Graduate-level course covering the application of data mining on software products and production.

notes: Completed every Honors/Advanced/AP Course Offered at PIHS (17).
Was actively involved as class Vice President, and in NHS, Debate, and band, etc.
